pros: I appreciate Pima so much! 2022 was a hard year, but we are working hard behind the scenes to get everything back on track, and it's working! My co-workers are my family, and I truly love coming to work every day.
cons: No real cons, just be prepared to work hard!

job_title: Clinical Director in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Supportive administration, thorough regulatory support, generally a great place to work as long as your program is succeeding and enrollments are high. PMI contributes to employee HSAs (max of $40/month), an uncommon practice for most employers.
cons: Health benefits are marginal at best and rather expensive. Insurance premiums increased by 14% this year. (HDHP with HSA plan, for reference.) Pharmacy benefits are absolutely useless - I'd save more money being uninsured. With PMI's 2022 pharmacy benefit manager I paid ~$50/month for my prescription. 2023 pharmacy benefit manager switched to CVS Caremark to "lower costs", and my prescription now costs $108/month for a medication with a retail price of $131 - total of a whopping $23 savings, despite it being a generic medication provided by CVS (obviously an in-network pharmacy.) I will never meet my $2500 deductible to benefit from any potential savings unless I experience an emergency. Communication was sparse regarding this change when it came time for open enrollment; employees were told to simply "check the pharmacy formulary" which provides misleading and inaccurate pricing estimates without specific plan and membership information, making it impossible to actually make a decision on benefits enrollment that would save money at the end of the day. I went from paying $600/year in prescriptions now to $1300/year with the exact same insurance plan, at a 14% increase in premium cost.

job_title: Medical Assistant Instructor in Houston, TX
pros: The students were open minded and very willing to learn
cons: The staff was disengaged. The staff did not have the students best interest in mind and were very unorganized. The students were not being taught correctly. and were being rushed through. It was not a good environment as the current staff did not want to assist the incoming new hires.

review_title: 2023 will be a transition year for PMI

The world has changed since the pandemic, PMI leadership needs to progress in the area of work/life balance. As with any company, the location you work at will determine your experience.

review_title: It has been a great experience
pros: Leadership is supportive and encourages growth. The campus environment is fun and colleagues are pleasant and keep each other's morale up. Times can be tough (just like in any job) but I have always felt safe to express when something isn't working. Our campus leadership makes me felt heard, but I also understand that they too have limits to what they can "fix" and how quickly. In reviewing some of the comments made previously I think it's ridiculous to try and hold one person accountable for company-wide issues. We are a TEAM and I recognize that as a campus/corporation, we can either make it happen, or break it. Tough times make tough people. You work in an employee owned company, then take ownership for your part.
cons: Cons- I can't think of any. In a perfect world we would be able to have endless funds. In the meantime, I will keep being creative and do my part to keep our classrooms alive with fun ways of learning.

pros: Amazing faculty and staff. ESOP benefits are outstanding. Communication between programs is second to none. Great, updated facilities. Too many to list.
cons: The only con I see is the way the community views Pima. Yes, we are a for profit school, but because of that, we make sure to go above and beyond what is expected of your typical community college. Examples: offering open labs and review sessions to students during free time, volunteering our time to assist with other program's skills competencies, etc. I have lots of Pima pride, and I want the community to recognize that we produce the highest quality students/employees. So again, we are for profit, but we are also for our students, for our patients, and for improving the lives of those who decide to walk through our doors.

review_title: The Quality of Work Life Depends on the Manager You Have
pros: PMI has core values that make this a great company to work for, such as ESOP, PTO, and being family-owned. They truly care about students and take education seriously. They do a lot to ensure graduates are prepared to be healthcare professionals and the Career Services team has been phenomenal when working with students to find them employment.
cons: I have had positive and negative experiences at this company and it's unfortunate, but much of those experiences and the quality of work life centers around the manager you have. Current campus management is a horror to work for. We are bleeding good people and it's a wonder that corporate doesn't see how many people are leaving or still think management is doing a good job. It is mind-boggling, for sure. They are all  about appearances so  a great show is executed  when visitors are here but the employees here do not support management because management does not support us. Every time some one quits we are fed a line about them wanting a new experience or wanting to be with family when we all know that many people find it difficult to work in this environment for people who believe they know everything and allow input from no one. Who wants to go to work every day and stay motivated under these circumstances? It is becoming more and more difficult. With layoffs coming, I am wondering if this is the time to bail and just call it a wash.

pros: ESOP, Great educators, accredited, two week vacation at Christmas and use to the best place.

job_title: Student Services Coordinator in Tucson, AZ
pros:
Fair Pay
Benefits are good
cons:
The company truly believes they have good company culture but the truth is, the "culture" you experience is truly dependent on the department you are in. You think you can go to HR but they only believe those in leadership, and you're pretty much forced to leave or wait around to be fired. I was isolated, belittled in meetings (by others in other departments) and because I made a few mistakes early on they took away my ability to do anything and then asked "why aren't you doing anything?" 
Instead of just saying things outright and being honest, they play games and try to scare you/intimidate you/blindside you. The only reason it didn't work with me was because by the time they were really trying to push me out, I had already signed another offer a week before they tried to fire me. 
Seriously, watch out! They think they are good and it's sad that they have departments that are literally bullying/isolating people into silence. 
I was even asked by a Manager if I was pregnant. She literally never spoke to me and then out of nowhere "Hey I got a feeling you're pregnant. Are you?" Who does that?!

review_title: You've Just Reached The Height of Higher Education
pros:
I've worked at my share of companies, and I tend to stay, but after 2 years, I feel it's time to move on. I've been here almost 10 years! Here's why...
1. It's rewarding: I feel that I'm changing lives everyday in my role as a high-level educator. 
2. Pima Medical is thinking about my retirement more than I am: We have 401K, employee match, stock-ownership, and one hell of a management team. 
3. No micromanagement! At least not in my position. This institute trusts me to do my work. I can appreciate that. 
4. It's stable: Other schools in the same category continue to fall while Pima Medical keeps surviving AND THRIVING into the future. It's wonderful to see a school doing things the right way.
cons:
If there are any negatives to this career, they are ones present anywhere you work with people. Here are the ones I've seen...
1. Office politics.
2. Taking to long to fire people who don't fit the culture. It's toxic! 

That's about it. I know there are students who will complain from time to time because they are not satisfied with something, and I've found they will be the same ones who complain no matter where they attend. So, take those with a grain of salt. Make your own decisions.

pros: I have had the opportunity to work with PMI for 9 years in an admissions capacity.  I can honestly say that I look forward to coming to work everyday. review_title: Great Company With a Great Culture
pros: A culture of collegiality and mutual respect exists at this institution. Students and employees are equally valued but we always ensure that the decisions that are made are done so with the best interest of the students. PMI is owned by both the employees and the Luebkes. As an ESOP company, we work with the mindset that we are not just employees but employee owners. This culture helps to ensure that everyone goes above and beyond to meet and exceed our standards of maintaining student success. Our main and primary focus is to provide high-quality education, prepare students to sit for their national certification/licensure exams, prepare students to be high functioning clinicians, and assist them with career placement. Bottom line is, if the students succeed, we all succeed. Likewise, if the faculty and staff are happy and motivated, they will then do their part in delivering the promise of our mission.
cons: At times there is an issue of follow through with projects.

review_title: Pima Medical Institute is an outstanding company to work for in every sense.
pros: I have never worked for a company that cares so much about employees.  I genuinely feel blessed to be a part of such a honorable company.  I have felt this way since shortly after being hired.  Everyone is very helpful on our campus and on the corporate level.  I always feel supported and valued.  I also must mention that we are blessed to have the most caring and supportive Campus Director here in Houston.  Phil is an extraordinary leader who has always been willing to offer guidance and direction when I have needed it.  One thing that I especially value about PMI is that there is no cutting corners or sweeping things under the rug.  I love that I work for a company with integrity that is genuinely honest and truly strives to meet and exceed the expectations of accrediting associations and comply with regulatory bodies.  I plan to continue working for PMI until retirement as a proud employee who is honored to be a part of such an outstanding group of individuals.
cons: I honestly have no complaints about the company.

pros: Working for Pima has been a life changing experience. Being hired over a year ago, I have been exposed to so many different facets of the healthcare industry and the world of career colleges in post-secondary education. I have learned that everything Pima Medical Institute does is intentional and carefully thought out: from their processes, to their feedback, to their willingness to expand and venture out into unknown territory. The culture is driven by an employee-owned mindset and on all of the campuses that I've been to, you feel the sense of family and teamwork. I am so grateful to work for a company that truly values my opinions, recognizes my efforts, and consistently provides me with the highest quality of support and encouragement. I come to work grateful and privileged to have such a fun job surrounded by truly unique coworkers!

pros: The culture at Pima is that people truly care about each other and the students. From the CEO to the administrative assistants, there is team work and comradery throughout the Company. I am so glad I made the decision to leave the job I had been at for the past 4 years and come here. The fact that the company is an ESOP means that the employees have partial ownership and will be rewarded with stock shares just for being a great employee. I no longer have to worry as much about about my retirement because of my stock options and their generous 401K match. The benefits are great, the generosity of management is unheard of in today's workforce. This company has allowed me to have less stress and a healthier work life balance.
cons: The pay tends to be on the low side for certain positions.

review_title: Proud to be a part of this Organization
job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Mesa, AZ
pros: The pros of working here are almost endless. I cannot say enough good things about how fair and diplomatic everyone is. From the janitor to the CEO - we are a family. We treat each other as family. Corporate office has always done what is fair with their employees. Even doing things that weren't their responsibility, they still "do the right thing." If it is for a student, or for an employee.  Everyone looks out for one another and if something happens to one, it happens to all. Can't say enough - I love going to work - We do have stresses but we take them on together and work together until it is resolved.

Pima is all about recognition and rewards for employees and student who do well.  This creates a wonderful atmosphere to work in.  I am very happy that I made the move to Pima.

pros: I love working at and for Pima! My boss is the bomb, and the associate campus director is down-to-earth and approachable! There are so many companies and schools out there which are solely financial based, but Pima is employee and student based. This is the best place I've ever worked! I've been in the medical field for 20+ years, and have worked for the past 35 years, and Pima Medical Institute is without question my dream job!

pros: I've been with Pima for 6 years, and it is an amazing company.  What I am impressed is that Pima started as a family business, very small, but even today as a big company, they carry that warm, caring environment where everyone cares about each other.  When you have that safe and healthy work place where employer cares about employee, the employee cares about coworkers (staff/faculty) and students, then students respect instructors back, and we appreciate each other.  It’s like a chain reaction of love.   The support I get from work is one of the main reasons that I love my work and make me want to be good at what I do each day.  I haven’t had a day that I didn’t want to come to work.  The team work is very important and Pima has that kind of support and good environment to grow. I am so thankful and fortunate to be working at Pima.

pros: Huge compassion and great family values in terms of what they are trying to accomplish.  Yes, they are for profit, but most successful companies are. Yes they realize students come first and they have natural passion for that.  Your not around for 40+ years if you are not helping people and that's what they are good at.

job_title: Regulatory Affairs Coordinator in Denver, CO
pros: My supervisor is my advocate. She values me and recognizes my work when it is extraordinary. I need to be challenged and she continues to provide me with projects that increase my knowledge and skills. She is an honest and ethical leader and her leadership instincts are impeccable.
cons: I really do not have any cons. I have worked for PMI for 11 years and I still love coming to work every day. I appreciate that PMI is an employee stock owned company. The ESOP not only provides the employees with a stock benefit, it creates a culture of a big family who owns a business. Companies with ESOPs and other broad-based employee ownership plans account for well over half of Fortune Magazine's "100 Best Companies to Work for in America". PMI's ESOP is a return on sweat equity - the harder we work, the more the company increases in value, and the higher the stock value.

pros: It is a crazy time out there with the COVID-19 pandemic, but without a doubt PIMA stands strong.  I have never been more impressed with how the leadership and the instructors  have come together to ensure that our students remained successful during these trying times.  There was no hesitation to ensure our students would continue their education from the Faculty and no hesitation that our Faculty would continue to be paid from our leadership.  Without a doubt, this makes a strong statement, and I am glad that PIMA is allowing us to work from home and protect ourselves and our families.
cons: Changing to an online platform overnight does not come easy for any organization but PIMA made it look easy.  We were provided guidelines and regulations to assist us in managing our transition, and we began this while we were on campus.

review_title: There aren't many schools like Pima left.
job_title: Medical Career Specialist in Mesa, AZ
pros: The owner seems to be down to earth. I've met the CEO several occasions. Overall got along with everyone even at other campuses. Pima has a very positive working environment.  It felt like one big family. The pay and benefits was above average in my opinion. If you do well and your hard work will be recognized.
cons: No job isn't going to be perfect. Had a few bad apples here and there. There are some employees who clearly struggle to their jobs. Some personality would clash with departments.

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in San Marcos, CA
pros: The Pima organization, from the top down, demonstrates a commitment to deliver what they promise- a great value in medical career education.  Every employee  I have encountered demonstrates professionalism, enthusiasm and a desire to contribute to developing outstanding medical technicians. Having started just before our current Covid-19 crisis, I have seen first hand how the instructors and administration have sought to support each other and the students through a very challenging transition to on-line learning.  It has not been easy, but there has been camaraderie and encouragement all around.  The corporate staff have provided excellent training and direction and have maintained high expectations for quality education to be delivered.
cons: It has not been an issue for me, but hours are varied due to different class schedules.

review_title: The Best Company I have Ever Worked For
job_title: Program Diector in El Paso, TX
pros: The culture of this company is simply amazing. Everyone, and I mean everyone, makes you feel like part of the family since day 1. I just started working for PMI less than two months ago, and I really hope I can retire here (I am 40 years old). The benefits, the interest for the welfare of the employee, the constant and never-ending assistance to all students (before they start, during the program, and after graduation is something I never experienced before.
cons: I have not experience anything negative in my short time at PMI. I have spoken to many employees who have been working 10, 15, 20 years in the company, and all of them LOVE Pima. I am extremely excited to be part of this great family.

job_title: DA Program Lead in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Its a blessing to work for such a great company that cares about its employee's as well as the students success. Having an awesome director here at our Phoenix Campus who empowers her staff makes the job all that much better. Our CEO Fred, makes sure he gets to know all his employees at all 17 campuses making sure we each feel that special bond. We have amazing benefits and to top it all off a fantastic ESOP program which all full time employees get to be apart of.
cons: Salary for faculty could be higher, however Arizona is ranked 48th in the U.S.  when it comes to an educators salary. On the other hand, being an educator is not about the salary, its about changing lives and this is what we do at Pima Medical Institute.

review_title: A overall great place to work
job_title: Career Services Advisor in Phoenix, AZ
pros: We are a team, we work as a team and we meet the students needs as a team.  All of the departments here come together to work with the students.  My favorite part is celebrating student success!  The atmosphere is comfortable, student centered and goal oriented.  We are encouraged to continue learning and focusing on professional development.
cons: There really isn't any.  We are a team and we have fun!

pros: The company has ethics and high standards.  Deeply cares about it's mission and it's impact on the community.  Appreciates the work and dedication from it's employees.
cons: Need to be "uniform" across all campuses.  Changing entire processes that work because a other do not follow rules.  Decisions to terminate employees when they are not doing their job drags on or never happens which puts a strain on other team members.  Minimal development opportunities available within the company.

review_title: Very Family Oriented; Takes care of their employees
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Chula Vista, CA
pros: I am one of the newer employees and 100% of the days I have worked we have had some kind of baked good provided for us. The team here campus wide is very friendly, helpful, and welcoming even the higher ups. We are well taken care of here.
cons: We eat... a lot! We have had lunch provided for us at least once a week and again some kind of baked good almost everyday so it's hard to say no to goodness and any new years resolution of losing weight or cutting out sugar may not work well for you.

job_title: Medical Career Specialist in Tucson, AZ
pros: We are a family owned company, but more importantly because of our ESOP program, we're a majority employee owned company! Having this really helps with not only feeling like you have a say in how things go, but your peers are more apt to contribute better because of having ownership. Management is great, our CEO is fantastic, we really hire some great people. Our instructors are invested in the school and students. I just love this place, and will hopefully retire with this school.
cons: It's hard to get promoted in this school because no-one leaves! This isn't necessarily a "con" per se - because that's a good thing. However, we are growing, so opportunities should arise.

review_title: Company with Integrity, Heart and promise for a bright future.
job_title: Student Accounts Manager in Tucson, AZ
pros:
1. Open door policy.
2. Participates in an Employee Stock Ownership Program.
3. Works to maintain the philosophy  of the founders which, among other practices, included the idea of giving back to our communities and  the brilliant idea of "people  first"(students, community and employees). 'When you put people first, company profits will follow. "
4. Leadership that any company would be proud of, on all levels.
cons: Some employee owners would like to be brought into conversations regarding  changes and growth of our company.  There is some of that but could be a lot more.

review_title: Love Pima but need good management
pros: I have worked at Pima for several years and it has been my favorite job! I love the people I see in the hallways each day. It has always been a positive environment and simply family. Seeing students succeed and helping them change their lives for the better makes a rewarding career.
cons: Not many cons besides 1 department I am concerned about. They had all been a great team until recently with new management. It's sad to see what they get put thru and how they are treated by the boss. I have seen Co workers in tears. They are all great people and here for the students.

pros: Pima is one of those companies that truly lives up to their mission and family-oriented  roots. I read these reviews before being hired in the hopes that the reality was somewhat close, but now have the privilege of being a part of changing lives and am provided all of the tools to thrive in that mission. I'm very happy to work here and have enjoyed the culture shift from my last position in vocational education.
cons: There are no real cons or limitations. Education has its challenges, but we are provided the resources and trust to solve problems.

pros: Since coming to PMI a year ago, I have felt nothing but supported and appreciated by my boss and other faculty members.  This is the most positive place to work!  The stress levels are low (most of the time) but it is truly a fun place to work and I am proud to be here.
cons: The only con here is the sense of isolation between programs since the campus is in different locations.  That will change once we move to our new location

job_title: Radiography Faculty in Chula Vista, CA
pros: We produce high-quality graduates who are sought-after in the local healthcare workforce and have established an extremely favorable reputation for us. It is intrinsically rewarding to be a part of changing people's lives in a positive way. Our campus team is always helpful and supportive, and we have become a sort of a family.
cons: Although rare, dealing with academic failure and disciplinary issues is not my favorite undertaking. Moreover, the administrative demands of the job sometimes make it a bit tedious, yet that is more than compensated for by our student success rate.

pros: Pima succeeds in a tough sector because it stays focused on what matters: educating students and helping them gain employment in their field of study. The same commitment to core values supports a great workplace. Employees own a majority of the company. We work hard and get paid well, and receive plenty of positive affirmations.
cons: I can think of no negative attributes. (Having represented Pima as as its attorney for 35 years (part-time GC for the past almost 4), I'm sure I'm biased. However, I have represented dozens of businesses over 37 years, and this one's great!

job_title: Lead Dental Assistant Instructor in Renton, WA
pros: Completely blown away by the warm reception by the current faculty,  management, and students.  The training and expectations were explained and facilitated wonderfully by management. This is a family oriented learning institute I am beyond excited to start my new journey with my colleagues. I look forward to being a positive influence to the new present and future dental assistants.
cons: Wish more people knew how great PIMA is and all the courses they have to offer. The great support staff they have in place in career services to help them a long the way.

review_title: Love this company and my coworkers!
job_title: Student Services Coordinator in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Great bunch of folks working together sharing the goal of student success in a family atmosphere. Instructors, staff and management all are passionate about making sure the students get the resources they need to succeed. Campus pride is evident when you walk in the door.  Employee ownership shows! Proud to work here with this great group of professionals. Corporate support is consistent and the benefits are great.
cons: The only thing I can say is a con is that I didn't work here sooner.  You get out what you put in.

job_title: Lead Pharmacy Technician in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Pima Medical Institute is by far the best company I have ever worked for. It is very rare to find a company that truly values their employees and their hard work. Despite the companies growth and expansion, PIMA still makes the effort to make every employee part of the family. The curriculum is the best I have ever seen and student satisfaction is high. PIMA cares about the success of each student that walks through the door. Support for faculty is outstanding in every way.
cons: I have no complaints about working for PIMA, I just wish I had found PIMA sooner.

pros: Employee focused company. Best retirement plan I've ever seen! A very hands off approach from management allowing you to do what you need to get your job done. Honestly if your manager is talking to here your not doing your job! Great environment to be in.
cons: Some of the paper work associated with the job is a little redundant. Sometimes a little to many channels to go through to get the things you need.

review_title: Working at Pima Medical Institute is like winning the job lottery!
pros: PMI is an employee owned company that genuinely values every member of the team. The corporate management and support staff come along side campus staff to assist rather than direct. During employee orientation one of the things that struck me was that the students were at the top of the org chart and top leadership was at the bottom of the org chart. Since 2014 I have evidenced this day after day, decision after decision. :)
cons: While it may be hard for some to believe... There are no cons being an Employee Owner at Pima Medical Institute!

pros: Pima Medical Institute is true to its mission, “to improve the quality of people’s lives by providing the best value in medical career education.” The leadership at Pima Medical Institute listens to its students, employees and community partners to constantly improve process and procedure efficacy. The organization as a whole is dedicated to developing and encouraging its employees.
cons: It is hard for me to articulate a con, as my experience has been so good. But perhaps the fact that Pima Medical Institute is a smaller organization and it therefore limits upward mobility. They do however offer a substantial amount of skills development and continued education.

review_title: I have been working at Pima Medical Institute for over 8 years
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Las Vegas, NV
pros: A very caring, giving, family oriented company with employee ownership through ESOP.  A school that cares about it's students and employees.  This is not a money hungry school out to rip people off, but a school that is out there to help those people that want to better their lives.
cons: None!  I've been with enough companys to know that PMI is special & I'm proud to be a part of it.

review_title: Progressive company with a terrific customer-first, people-first attitude!
pros:
1. Pima is a company that provides outstanding opportunities for professionals with excellent people skills.
2.  Pima is a very rewarding place to work as the company fully supports its Mission Statement of improving lives by providing the best value in medical career education.
3.  Pima has outstanding upper management leadership that has family values, values of high integrity and values that provide excellence in service delivery.
4.  Pima has a great sense of teamwork with its intra service delivery between its employees at the Corporate level and the campuses.
5.  Pima is a company that allows you to "knock yourself out" with your passion!  You can give all that you want!
6.  Pima has a very promising future with phenomenal metrics, an impressive rising financial picture and a strong demand for services offered.
7.  Pima provides a professional and productive and safe work environment.  It is fun to work at Pima. I look forward to go to work every morning as soon as my feet hit the floor!
cons:
This is actually a good thing, but don't apply to Pima if you just want to put in your time.  Everyone works hard and stays on task.

Some of the pay ranges could be somewhat higher, but there is an excellent retirement plan that more than makes the difference.

pros:
I have been employed by Pima Medical Institute for 18 months and I have found a new family. I have felt nothing but love and respect from everyone within the company as well as the students that attend our school. With the assistance of Pima's tuition assistance reimbursement benefit, I was able to finish my associate degree, and I will complete my bachelor degree in business management by August 2019. Pima treats their staff with admiration and continually shows its appreciation for its employees with annual and holiday bonuses. I also had the privilege of being selected by my peer’s to be a peak performer in 2018. Pima has 18 different campuses and they take the time to recognize two people from each campus annually as peak performers. As a peak performer Pima sent us and a guest on an all-expense paid trip to Huntington Beach, California at an amazing resort for four full days. Prior to my career at Pima I was a military officer in the United States Army for 25 years, and the respect and patriotism that I have felt since I started working has been amazing as well as humbling.  
Pima is an Employee Stock Owned Company (ESOP); as an employee owner I am committed to Pima Medical Institute and feel an immense sense of pride being part of such a strong, successful institution. The legacy and tradition passed on to us from our founders to operate with integrity and grace will always be ingrained in my leadership style. I see an extremely bright future for PMI and look forward to being a part of that realization.
cons: I cannot ever get enough of the respect and admiration I receive from all of the employees and students here at Pima Medical Institute.

pros:
The staff and faculty are dedicated to student learning as well as making the work environment fun and collaborative. 

The leadership does "the right thing" for students and employees. It's not about the money - it's about education.

There are lots of benefits for employees that keeps the retention of personnel high (Employee Stock Options, Open Book Management, educational scholarships, matching 401K) but the biggest reason people stay is because we treat each other with respect.

Pima Medical Institute is a great place to work and go to school.
cons: Whatever the cons are they get worked out.

review_title: Be Very Careful On Accepting ANY Job
pros: The employee stock plan is pretty good. Teaching online is lucrative when also teaching classes on the ground
cons: Management is only out to make sure as many students as possible get through. I was asked to change grades to pass students. Was told FLAT OUT to make the curriculum easier even if the student wouldn't be functional in the job field. Management after I left asked externship site to falsify paperwork to pass a student rejected for the 3rd time at an externship site. Management also falsifies reports against instructors if an instructor won't comply with passing students

pros: This company is amazing!  It truly cares for its employees and more importantly its students.  I have worked for PMI almost 8 years and love getting up in the morning knowing I am going to see my PMI family!!!!!  Our Employee Stock Option Plan is the best in the business.
cons: I don't see many cons with PMI, however would like to see assistants for the various coordinators and the campus directors especially at the larger campuses.

pros: By far the best! I have worked at our competitor & Pima exceeds everything. I especially love the ESOP! I have a say in how we move forward. Also, the fact that I impact the lives of our students everyday!
cons: Honestly the only thing that springs to mind, is that some of the meetings (i.e. with our fitness guru) happens during the day and I have my other job and can't attend.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Marcos, CA
pros: Family owned, ESOP, great people to work with, competitive salaries, other possible bonuses, free turkey!, incredible support from our Mother Ship! AMAZING Director of Education!
cons: Some management not in the healthcare field, training and onboarding may not be sufficient for everyone but that is quickly changing; occasional breakdown in communication to all levels

job_title: General Education Teacher in Albuquerque, NM
pros:
PIMA Medical Institute is the right place to work for you if:
- you are a devoted and enthusiastic employee
- you are loyal and patient with your customers/students/coworkers
- you want to build a long-term relationship with the company
- you possess life-giving energy and believe in second chance
- you are inspired to change other people's lives and create a positive ripple effect in your community
- you have the company ownership mentality and leadership qualities
cons: As anywhere in the medical world, there are long work hours and potential burnout

review_title: PMI is the best company that I have ever worked for!
job_title: Physical Therapist Assistant Instructor in Mesa, AZ
pros: PMI shows how much they care and support both their staff and students in a variety of ways. They provide necessary tools and resources to promote individual and program success. During the COVID-19 outbreak, staff were given resources and assistance to be able to transition their classrooms to the online learning environment in a smooth manner.  I definitely feel equipped and confident to continue to be successful during this weird period of time.
cons: I honestly cannot think of anything.

job_title: Faculty Coordinator in Las Vegas, NV
pros: This company puts their students first, regardless.  I love the honesty and adherence to solid values that makes this company the leader in private education.  I've been here 8 years.  It's been the best place I've worked at in my life.
cons: No company is perfect, but there is nothing of any significance to complain about.  If issues arise, they are normally resolved to everyone's satisfaction at the campus level.

review_title: Wish all companies operated like PMI
pros: PMI has a deserved reputation of quality and student centered education. The faculty, seems to genuinely care about training qualified medical professionals to begin a career, not just get a job. All colleges should approach education this way!
cons: Many of the millennial  students seems to wait for things to be delivered on a platter, rather than working for it. This isn't a reflection on PMI, but perhaps try to attract more mature students and everyone wins.

job_title: Federal Work Study Student in Seattle, WA
pros:
Good for resume.
 If your a student looking to make some extra cash it will pay.\
Its inside a office setting;no harsh weather conditions.
cons: Being an outsider to the organization, limits understanding and there is a under tone of condescending attitudes. Limited networking possibilities. The Staff has a very two faced approach to interactions with students and contracted companies that take on the schools Interns. Flirting with students demoralizes and shows disrespect to students-Professional conduct is not exemplified every member in this small office.

job_title: Career Services Advisor in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Working for Pima has been so incredible! The people are so supportive and inspiring.  They are making a difference in people's lives and have enabled me to do the same. The benefits are unheard of and really show that they truly value their employees. I fell blessed to work for this organization.
cons: the only con is that i am ruined for any other job. Best job I have ever had!

pros:
I Worked at PMI for 19 years, the time there I was treated with respect and as a valued employee.  PMI has great benefits which is a huge plus.

The best reward of all was seeing how many people became successful by choosing to attend PMI.  They now had new careers which enriched their lives professionally and financially.  It gave me satisfaction to see the increase in pride that each of these individuals exhibited.
cons: Because of my dedication I wored to many hours.

review_title: The company's philosophy remains the same since 1972
pros: The managers are always approachable not only at the local campus level, but also at the corporate level. The VP knows every employees name which is impressive. The company is student focused and they value the ideas of the employees. It is important to the company that they treat each employee with respect and with value. This makes the employment turn over rate very low
cons: Would like to see the regional directors have more time to spend with employees and not just with management team

pros:
Mission and Philosophy of Owners truly lived
Outstanding lateral teams
Fun environment in which to work
Bonus system
Amazing retirement program - all paid by employer
Good 401K employer matching contribution
Good reputation in service sector
Responsive upper management
cons:
Salary way below market
Hierarchical communication poor - started as small close knit company and communication still assumes that intimate level, which doesn't suit the growth of the company
Physical environment doesn't compare to other market sectors
No flexible scheduling considered or allowed
Technology support outdated and slow to respond to changes

review_title: Amazing! A for-profit school that takes its mission seriously.
pros:
Student-first: PMI is the epitome of none left behind in the education process (unless the individual chooses it).  

ESOP:  PMI rewards the efforts of their staff with an ESOP for employees to take ownership in their work and retirement.
cons: Cons are consistent with most employers - it depends on the viewpoint of the individual.

pros: Fully supportive staff, a genuine concern and support for each student, outstanding leadership and just all-around good people, from students to staff. This organization is one of the few good ones left.
cons: No cons at all. I have enjoyed working for this school from day one.

pros: The entire organization seems to have a student centered perspective. Students are what drives the success of PMI, and their importance is apparent.
cons: Limited growth opportunities. But I think that's the result of a flat organization and part of the company's long term formula.

review_title: Excellent Company with a Family Culture
pros: As an instructor we are given the autonomy to design our lesson plans as we see fit with a lot of encouragement from everyone. Very upbeat, positive people at all levels.
cons: Equipment access was a bit hit or miss but has gotten better.

review_title: Great Company, Not so great campus leadership
pros:
Employee owned
Open Door policy
Student Focused

Campus leadership is questionable at best. Too much focus on student enrollment numbers is leading to poor quality of students.This campus starting to become a "diploma mill" 
Compensation at this campus isn't that great either

review_title: I enjoy coming to work each day
job_title: Full Time Faculty in Albuquerque, NM
pros: Supportive environment between management, faculty, and staff.  ESOP company so we all have a stake in Pima's success.   We change peoples lives!
cons: Student high school preparation in New Mexico is abysmal in regards to study skills, math, and writing.  This makes it time consuming working with underprepared students.  All that said, when these students find success in our Program, it is deeply gratifying as an instructor.

review_title: PMI is the "Hotel California" of EDU;s .... You will check in but never leave.
pros: Pima Medical Institute is a wonderful place to work, it's a family/employee owned company which allows everyone to benefit from successful outcomes.  The org chart is flipped (the students are on the top) which helps us remember why we go to work each day.  We are changing lives, preparing medical professionals for fantastic futures and helping our local communities It's a "feel good" organization.
cons: As with many organizations, communication could improve.

pros: Clear mission, trust, empowerment, support, compassion. The words I think of when describing this organization - I attended PMI as a student, and came back to teach here. With their support I continued my education and grew into my current position as program director. I speak from the heart when I say that I love this institution, and feel blessed to work with such amazing human beings.
cons: I don't have any cons to report.

job_title: Career Services Coordinator in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: I enjoy working at Pima because the company truly lives up to the mission. I enjoy having a part in assisting graduates in meeting their goals and watching them succeed for themselves and their families.  I like that there is variety in the daily grind to keep me on my toes!
cons: The only downside is that I rarely get to see my counterparts and would like to have time to celebrate successes, get best practices, etc.

job_title: Career Services Coordinator in Phoenix, AZ
pros: I love my job !! I am happy to come into work everyday! I feel like part of a team. I can not wait to grow with this company. Exciting changes to come soon.
cons: Utilize more ideas to keep our student ahead when it comes to technology.

review_title: Working here is best case scenario!
pros: It is nice to feel appreciated by your campus director. All the instructors and admin staff help each other and the atmosphere is family like. I love my job and the management allows you to be autonomous but still has guidelines to follow. Structure without tying your hands. Benefits are great also. ESOP also!!
cons: Insurance is a little pricey, but it is good coverage.

review_title: Big corporate-like solutions by a family-like organization
job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Family-like, close knit environment with supportive staff and faculty. Demonstrated a proactive approach centered on students well before others during the current pandemic crisis. Voiced appreciation of faculty, awareness of efforts and provided a myriad of resources and structured guidance for instructors. Top notch.
cons: Only the growing pains of transitioning from a small family owner organization to an employee owned company

pros: Have been there more than 5 years.  Love the idea of being an employee owner (ESOP).   Management does listen to new ideas.  Definitely a team approach!

pros: The "higher ups" are humans with beautiful hearts. They are not your typical money hungry bosses. They actually laugh with you and smile at you.  You get fed a lot. You do not work on weekends. Bosses are flexible and understanding. Everyone is family in the WHOLE company.
cons: You will never take another opportunity, because you'd be stupid to leave :). No one ever quits

job_title: Director of Clinical Education in Denver, CO
pros: Pima has consistently supported students, faculty and staff. They have recently partnered with Franklin Covey to provide high-level in-services and ongoing resources to nurture a culture of trust and professionalism. I particularly appreciate that they pay for my annual professional dues and the cost of one conference each year.
cons: Sometimes it feels difficult to take time off, due to the year-round curriculum schedule.

review_title: There is NO ONE that compares to Pima Medical Institute!  If integrity matters to you, this is the place!
pros: Amazing place to work!  Employee owned company!  The most caring professionals when it comes to students and their success!  You truly cannot ask for a better place for your career!
cons: I truly cannot think of anything!

review_title: Pima pride runs deep throughout the entire organization.

pros: Ethical and transparent, always doing the right thing because it's the right thing to do, not because a regulatory agency is looking in. People are treated as people, not as numbers or revenue.

pros: Amazing company with stable and proactive leadership. Doing the right thing for the student is always the number one priority and is reflected onto the employees as well.
cons: There has never been a time during my 7+ years so far that I have found a con with Pima.

review_title: Clinical Instructor- Great place to work. Great nursing program.

pros: An employer where management truly cares about their employees and makes them feel valued. Just made me even more grateful too work for this company.
cons: There have been some downs, but they always get resolved and it just becomes a learning experience.

review_title: A great place to grow and help others.

job_title: Career Services Advisor in Albuquerque, NM

I have never seen a group of staff and facility members more dedicated to their student’s success!  Pima Medical Institute understands and encourages staff members to have a balanced work and life style.

review_title: Pima is a great place to work!
job_title: Career Services Coordinator in San Marcos, CA

pros: Working here gives you the opportunity to make a difference in the life of your students while being part of an amazing team. review_title: I currently work for Pima Medical Institute.

pros: The perfect combination of family and employee ownership. PMI focuses on what  is best for people rather than being guided solely on financial impact. The culture of the company is second to none.

review_title: San Marcos is the WORST campus
